alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge; Grayson; Hancock; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 12:57AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hancock, northwestern Grayson, southwestern Breckinridge and northeastern Ohio Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1156 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Whitesville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Grayson, southeastern Hancock, northeastern Ohio and southwestern Breckinridge Counties, including the following locations... Goering, Ralph, Shreve, Pellville, Magan, Tar Fork, Cabot, Weberstown, Vanzant and Ellmitch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
